benchmark_details.name: Interleaved Cognitive Evaluation (ICE)
benchmark_details.overview: The Interleaved Cognitive Evaluation (ICE) benchmark systematically manipulates cognitive load factors on multi-hop reasoning tasks to measure the impact of extraneous load on model performance.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the impact of cognitive load on the reasoning capabilities of large language models in a structured manner.

data.source: Derived from curated datasets including U.S. SEC filings, FanOutQA, and MINTQA.

methodology.calculation: Exact-Match accuracy is calculated based on the proportion of correct answers provided by models across various conditions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Exact-Match accuracy indicates better reasoning capability under varying cognitive load conditions.
methodology.baseline_results: Gemini-2.0-Flash-001 achieved 0.85 EM in Control conditions; Llama-3-8B-Instruct, Llama-3-70B-Instruct, Mistral-7B-Instruct-v0.2 achieved 0% EM across conditions.
methodology.validation: Performance was validated through repeated tests under standardized conditions.
